metadata.title: Trump raises topic of Ukraine's EU membership with Orban, Bloomberg reports

left: President Donald Trump called Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban after discussing Ukraine with President Volodymyr Zelensky and European leaders in Washington D.C.
European leaders urged Trump to push Orban to drop his opposition to Ukraine’s EU accession talks.
During the call, Hungary expressed interest in hosting future talks between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Zelensky.
Orban stated that linking Ukraine’s EU membership with security guarantees was 'unnecessary and dangerous' on Facebook.
center: President Donald Trump called Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban after discussing Ukraine with President Volodymyr Zelensky and European leaders in Washington D.C.
European leaders urged Trump to push Orban to drop his opposition to Ukraine’s EU accession talks.
During the call, Hungary expressed interest in hosting future talks between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Zelensky.
Orban stated that linking Ukraine’s EU membership with security guarantees was 'unnecessary and dangerous' on Facebook.
right: US President Donald Trump spoke with Viktor Orbán on August 18 to discuss Hungary's opposition to Ukraine's EU accession, after meetings with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and European leaders.
Trump announced he is seeking a leader-level summit between Russia and Ukraine after his discussions on August 18.
European leaders encouraged Trump to persuade Orbán to support Ukraine's EU membership amidst Hungary's strong criticism of it.
The EU has a pattern of disregarding referendum results related to itself.
